text:
Have one thread consisting of two Simple Controllers.  The first consisting of 
a single HTTP Request used to setup of the form.  The second consisting of a 
single HTTP Request for post processing of the form.  The script looks like the 
following:

Thread
-Simple Controller
--HTTP Request (Form Setup - GET method)
-Simple Controller
--Modification Controller
---HTML Parameter Mask
---HTML Parameter Mask
---HTML Parameter Mask
---HTTP HTML Link Parser
---HTTP Request (Form Processor - POST method)

The HTML Parameter Masks work as they should, but for some reason JMeter just 
can't seem to find the form values to use with the parser.  The parameters that 
are to use the parser in the form processer have been specified and with a 
value of .* .  Please send me any feedback you can.  

This is a simple test and should be reproducable.  As a side note, the requests 
are accessing JSP pages.  I have taken a look at the returned html after 
rendering of the page to html and the appropriate form fields do exist.
creator: bfunk@ptc.com

text:
Does it work now with 1.8?

If it doesn't, please send attach Test Case and the form page to this bug
report. (You can obtain the form page with your browser and do a "Save page").
Even better if you can reproduce this on some site accessible over the Internet
so that we can actually try out.
creator: jsalvata@atg.com
jsalvata@atg.com
text:
Can't reproduce this with some more info. Anyway, it should be possible to work
around the problem using regexFunctions. So I'm setting this to medium priority.

creator: mstover1@apache.org
text:
this is impossible to debug as is. I'd recommend closing it since we haven't
heard from the reporter in a while.  It could be he's using a bad regular
expression, or has some other problem we'd never guess.
